responses.content:
```yaml
leads:
  - headline: Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) in Custom Locale Plugin
    analysis: |
      The Custom Locale plugin allows administrators to override locale keys with custom values. 
      These custom values are not properly sanitized before being displayed on the website, 
      creating a cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability. 

      An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by persuading an administrator to save a 
      malicious payload as a custom locale value. When this value is displayed on the 
      website, the attacker's JavaScript code would execute in the context of the victim's browser, 
      potentially allowing the attacker to steal session cookies, redirect users to malicious 
      websites, or perform other malicious actions.
    cwe: CWE-79
    function_names: []
    filenames: 
      - js/customLocale.js
      - cypress/tests/functional/CustomLocale.cy.js
    classification: very promising
```

leads.headline: Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) in Custom Locale Plugin
leads.analysis:
The Custom Locale plugin allows administrators to override locale keys with custom values. 
These custom values are not properly sanitized before being displayed on the website, 
creating a cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability. 

An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by persuading an administrator to save a 
malicious payload as a custom locale value. When this value is displayed on the 
website, the attacker's JavaScript code would execute in the context of the victim's browser, 
potentially allowing the attacker to steal session cookies, redirect users to malicious 
websites, or perform other malicious actions.
